name: Courtyard by Marriott Cranbury South Brunswick

reviews.title: Great base for touring central NJ
reviews.text: We stayed here 3 nights as a base for our sight seeing trip to central NJ. It's a nice hotel with good access to everywhere - you can get straight onto the NJ Turnpike as the hotel is near exit 8A and right on highway 130. Our room as ready for us when we arrived (which was a bit early at around 2.30pm)

reviews.title: Great stop off point on Interstate 95
reviews.text: The receptionist (Yolanda I think) was very welcoming and gave us lists of nearby restaurants to consider plus details of local places that delivered food to the hotel (their hotel restaurant wouldn't be open in the evenings during Friday & Saturday). However we ate at the hotel on our first evening (Thursday) and the food was fine - it was a quiet night so service was excellent too.

Our room overlooked the front of the hotel and I was a bit concerned that it would be very noisy - but I was wrong. We both slept well all three nights (and I really am a light sleeper). The bed was extremely comfortable and the towels and linens were fresh and clean. The room had a large desk, ample storage and a large flat screen TV which was excellent. There was also a sofa (bed), table and a balcony. Lighting was good (why are so many hotel rooms so dark?) the overall décor is quite dark but the sun shone into the room all day so you didn't notice it. My only quibble (and it is very small) is that the grout around one end of the bath needed replacing.
reviews.title: Nice accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathrooms themselves are kept very clean but the grout is showing signs of mould which (for me) is very off putting. I didn't report this at the time as I know it's not a 5 minute job to resolve but it does need to be addressed (and I've mentioned it in the online feedback form that was e-mailed to me). Other than that, everything in our room was clean and kept well stocked. We got a good rate of $99 per night which also included free internet access - we both thought that this was excellent value.
reviews.title: Accomadating staff.

likes.disliked: — There are no restaurants, gas stations, stores, etc...anywhere near this place. It's a no man's land.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a nice surprise in the middle of industrial park nation on 95. We were looking for a mid way point on our trip and this lovely hotel was a perfect stop. The room was clean, updated and the bed was one of the most comfortable ever. I have to admit I have a very hard time sleeping in a hotel. But I slept so great I couldn't believe it. The breakfast in the am, was not part of the room price, but was worth every penny. The hot buffett was off the charts. I am very picky about eggs and such, but all of the breakfast was awesome. What a nice stop off point on your way to NYC or DC. This is the place to stop!!!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, bad service

reviews.text: Hotel is clean, nice, newer rooms, and accessible from the turnpike. The hotel has a typical over-priced breakfast but a good selection and a nice coffee set-up. Unlike most Courtyards, there was more than 1 person working the breakfast setup and they were quick to get a drink for you, grab the bill, or give you a to-go container. Also, there is a bar that serves beer/liquor until 11pm. The air-con system is slightly noisy, but it never bothered me. I asked for my free gift and got it. Overall, this is an above average Marriott.
reviews.title: Clean, pleasant, very nice

reviews.text: Better-than-average Courtyard, new facility, easy access on and off the turnpike.
reviews.title: Very nice

reviews.text: Cons: Very noisy heating/air con. Desk light did not work. No fridge or mini bar. Decor looked pretty tired.
reviews.title: Spotless and convenient
Perkless (and sleepless) just off the turnpike
reviews.text: Free internet worked well. I used my Marriot rewards to stay 3 nights. A great return as it is not in a high category. The hotel was spotless,and housekeeping did an outstanding job Nice decor, and it had a new look to it. Very courteous and helpful front desk. Breakfast buffet looked great, waittress was kind enough to give me the just coffee/bagel option. Good service in there (which is a bar at night.)

reviews.title: This hotel was very nice.
reviews.text: This hotel was very nice. I was there 1 night (July 2-3) and it was a pleasant stay. The room was very spacious. We thought this hotel was close to the Old Bridge Township Raceway Park but its about 20 mins if you don't get lost finding it. This hotel was not near any restaurants. The closest restaurant we found was TGI Friday's which was about 15 mins from the hotel. Besides that, its a pretty good hotel. Would stay again.

reviews.title: First Stay of this Wonderful Hotel ...
reviews.text: This hotel is very conveniently located at NJ Turnpike x8A at Rt32, and it is also easy reachable from Rt 130 to Rt 32, sort of heading NJ Turnpike ... I am wondering it could be one of the best hotels to stay should people coming from South to visit New York City. The parking lot is free and plenty, instead of $15 to $30 at Jersey City...

reviews.title: I Love this place!
reviews.text: The front desk staff is very friendly, and the room is nice with seperated sink, the bath has marble floor and nice wall paper. The bed is very comfortable with sufficient lighting. The lights are all "yellow" not "white"; that makes the room warmer.

aka: Courtyard By Marriott Cranbury South Brunswick Hotel Cranbury
